title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

text: puzzling phenomenon, which doubtless no one has yet forgotten.  Not to
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: platform, I saw a cabin six feet long, in which Conseil and Ned Land,
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: enchanted with their repast, were devouring it with avidity.  Then a
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: door opened into a kitchen nine feet long, situated between the large
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: store-rooms. There electricity, better than gas itself, did all the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: cooking.  The streams under the furnaces gave out to the sponges of
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: platina a heat which was regularly kept up and distributed.  They also
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: heated a distilling apparatus, which, by evaporation, furnished
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: excellent drinkable water.  Near this kitchen was a bathroom
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: comfortably furnished, with hot and cold water taps.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: Next to the kitchen was the berth-room of the vessel, sixteen feet
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: long.  But the door was shut, and I could not see the management of it,
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: which might have given me an idea of the number of men employed on
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: board the Nautilus.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: At the bottom was a fourth partition that separated this office from
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: the engine-room. A door opened, and I found myself in the compartment
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: where Captain Nemo--certainly an engineer of a very high order--had
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: arranged his locomotive machinery.  This engine-room, clearly lighted,
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: did not measure less than sixty-five feet in length.  It was divided
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: into two parts; the first contained the materials for producing
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: electricity, and the second the machinery that connected it with the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: screw.  I examined it with great interest, in order to understand the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: machinery of the Nautilus.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "You see," said the Captain, "I use Bunsen's contrivances, not
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ruhmkorff's. Those would not have been powerful enough.  Bunsen's are
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: fewer in number, but strong and large, which experience proves to be
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: the best.  The electricity produced passes forward, where it works, by
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: electro-magnets of great size, on a system of levers and cog-wheels
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: that transmit the movement to the axle of the screw.  This one, the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: diameter of which is nineteen feet, and the thread twenty-three feet,
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: performs about 120 revolutions in a second."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And you get then?"
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "A speed of fifty miles an hour."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I have seen the Nautilus manoeuvre before the Abraham Lincoln, and I
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: have my own ideas as to its speed.  But this is not enough.  We must
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: see where we go.  We must be able to direct it to the right, to the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: left, above, below.  How do you get to the great depths, where you find
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: an increasing resistance, which is rated by hundreds of atmospheres?
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: How do you return to the surface of the ocean?  And how do you maintain
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: yourselves in the requisite medium?  Am I asking too much?"
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Not at all, Professor," replied the Captain, with some hesitation;
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "since you may never leave this submarine boat.  Come into the saloon,
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: it is our usual study, and there you will learn all you want to know
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: about the Nautilus."

text: A moment after we were seated on a divan in the saloon smoking.  The
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: Captain showed me a sketch that gave the plan, section, and elevation
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the Nautilus.  Then he began his description in these words:
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Here, M. Aronnax, are the several dimensions of the boat you are in.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: It is an elongated cylinder with conical ends.  It is very like a cigar
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: in shape, a shape already adopted in London in several constructions of
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: the same sort.  The length of this cylinder, from stem to stern, is
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: exactly 232 feet, and its maximum breadth is twenty-six feet.  It is
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: not built quite like your long-voyage steamers, but its lines are
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: sufficiently long, and its curves prolonged enough, to allow the water
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: to slide off easily, and oppose no obstacle to its passage.  These two
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: dimensions enable you to obtain by a simple calculation the surface and
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: cubic contents of the Nautilus.  Its area measures 6,032 feet; and its
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: contents about 1,500 cubic yards; that is to say, when completely
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: immersed it displaces 50,000 feet of water, or weighs 1,500 tons.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "When I made the plans for this submarine vessel, I meant that
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: nine-tenths should be submerged:  consequently it ought only to
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: displace nine-tenths of its bulk, that is to say, only to weigh that
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: number of tons.  I ought not, therefore, to have exceeded that weight,
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: constructing it on the aforesaid dimensions.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "The Nautilus is composed of two hulls, one inside, the other outside,
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: joined by T-shaped irons, which render it very strong.  Indeed, owing
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: to this cellular arrangement it resists like a block, as if it were
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: solid.  Its sides cannot yield; it coheres spontaneously, and not by
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: the closeness of its rivets; and its perfect union of the materials
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: enables it to defy the roughest seas.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "These two hulls are composed of steel plates, whose density is from .7
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: to .8 that of water.  The first is not less than two inches and a half
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: thick and weighs 394 tons.  The second envelope, the keel, twenty
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: inches high and ten thick, weighs only sixty-two tons.  The engine, the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: ballast, the several accessories and apparatus appendages, the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: partitions and bulkheads, weigh 961.62 tons.  Do you follow all this?"
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I do."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Then, when the Nautilus is afloat under these circumstances, one-tenth
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: is out of the water.  Now, if I have made reservoirs of a size equal to
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: this tenth, or capable of holding 150 tons, and if I fill them with
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: water, the boat, weighing then 1,507 tons, will be completely immersed.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: That would happen, Professor.  These reservoirs are in the lower part
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the Nautilus.  I turn on taps and they fill, and the vessel sinks
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: that had just been level with the surface."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Well, Captain, but now we come to the real difficulty.  I can
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: understand your rising to the surface; but, diving below the surface,
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: does not your submarine contrivance encounter a pressure, and
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: consequently undergo an upward thrust of one atmosphere for every
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: thirty feet of water, just about fifteen pounds per square inch?"
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Just so, sir."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Then, unless you quite fill the Nautilus, I do not see how you can
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: draw it down to those depths."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Professor, you must not confound statics with dynamics or you will be
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: exposed to grave errors.  There is very little labour spent in
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: attaining the lower regions of the ocean, for all bodies have a
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: tendency to sink.  When I wanted to find out the necessary increase of
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: weight required to sink the Nautilus, I had only to calculate the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: reduction of volume that sea-water acquires according to the depth."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "That is evident."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Now, if water is not absolutely incompressible, it is at least capable
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: of very slight compression.  Indeed, after the most recent calculations
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: this reduction is only .000436 of an atmosphere for each thirty feet of
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: depth.  If we want to sink 3,000 feet, I should keep account of the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: reduction of bulk under a pressure equal to that of a column of water
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: of a thousand feet.  The calculation is easily verified.  Now, I have
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: supplementary reservoirs capable of holding a hundred tons.  Therefore
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: I can sink to a considerable depth.  When I wish to rise to the level
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the sea, I only let off the water, and empty all the reservoirs if I
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: want the Nautilus to emerge from the tenth part of her total capacity."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: I had nothing to object to these reasonings.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I admit your calculations, Captain," I replied; "I should be wrong to
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: dispute them since daily experience confirms them; but I foresee a real
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: difficulty in the way."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "What, sir?"
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "When you are about 1,000 feet deep, the walls of the Nautilus bear a
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: pressure of 100 atmospheres.  If, then, just now you were to empty the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: supplementary reservoirs, to lighten the vessel, and to go up to the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: surface, the pumps must overcome the pressure of 100 atmospheres, which
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: is 1,500 lbs.  per square inch.  From that a power----"
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "That electricity alone can give," said the Captain, hastily.  "I
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: repeat, sir, that the dynamic power of my engines is almost infinite.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: The pumps of the Nautilus have an enormous power, as you must have
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: observed when their jets of water burst like a torrent upon the Abraham
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: Lincoln.  Besides, I use subsidiary reservoirs only to attain a mean
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: depth of 750 to 1,000 fathoms, and that with a view of managing my
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: machines.  Also, when I have a mind to visit the depths of the ocean
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: five or six mlles below the surface, I make use of slower but not less
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: infallible means."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "What are they, Captain?"
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "That involves my telling you how the Nautilus is worked."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I am impatient to learn."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "To steer this boat to starboard or port, to turn, in a word, following
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: a horizontal plan, I use an ordinary rudder fixed on the back of the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: stern-post, and with one wheel and some tackle to steer by.  But I can
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: also make the Nautilus rise and sink, and sink and rise, by a vertical
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: movement by means of two inclined planes fastened to its sides,
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: opposite the centre of flotation, planes that move in every direction,
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: and that are worked by powerful levers from the interior.  If the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: planes are kept parallel with the boat, it moves horizontally.  If
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: slanted, the Nautilus, according to this inclination, and under the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: influence of the screw, either sinks diagonally or rises diagonally as
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: it suits me.  And even if I wish to rise more quickly to the surface, I
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: ship the screw, and the pressure of the water causes the Nautilus to
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: rise vertically like a balloon filled with hydrogen."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Bravo, Captain!  But how can the steersman follow the route in the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: middle of the waters?"
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "The steersman is placed in a glazed box, that is raised about the hull
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the Nautilus, and furnished with lenses."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Are these lenses capable of resisting such pressure?"
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Perfectly.  Glass, which breaks at a blow, is, nevertheless, capable
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: of offering considerable resistance.  During some experiments of
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: fishing by electric light in 1864 in the Northern Seas, we saw plates
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: less than a third of an inch thick resist a pressure of sixteen
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: atmospheres.  Now, the glass that I use is not less than thirty times
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: thicker."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Granted.  But, after all, in order to see, the light must exceed the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: darkness, and in the midst of the darkness in the water, how can you
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: see?"
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Behind the steersman's cage is placed a powerful electric reflector,
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: the rays from which light up the sea for half a mile in front."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Ah! bravo, bravo, Captain!  Now I can account for this phosphorescence
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: in the supposed narwhal that puzzled us so.  I now ask you if the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: boarding of the Nautilus and of the Scotia, that has made such a noise,
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: has been the result of a chance rencontre?"
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Quite accidental, sir.  I was sailing only one fathom below the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: surface of the water when the shock came.  It had no bad result."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "None, sir.  But now, about your rencontre with the Abraham Lincoln?"
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Professor, I am sorry for one of the best vessels in the American
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: navy; but they attacked me, and I was bound to defend myself.  I
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: contented myself, however, with putting the frigate hors de combat; she
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: will not have any difficulty in getting repaired at the next port."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Ah, Commander! your Nautilus is certainly a marvellous boat."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Yes, Professor; and I love it as if it were part of myself.  If danger
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: threatens one of your vessels on the ocean, the first impression is the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: feeling of an abyss above and below.  On the Nautilus men's hearts
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: never fail them.  No defects to be afraid of, for the double shell is
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: as firm as iron; no rigging to attend to; no sails for the wind to
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: carry away; no boilers to burst; no fire to fear, for the vessel is
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: made of iron, not of wood; no coal to run short, for electricity is the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: only mechanical agent; no collision to fear, for it alone swims in deep
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

text: We had at last arrived on the borders of this forest, doubtless one of
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: own, and considered he had the same right over it that the first men
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: had in the first days of the world.  And, indeed, who would have
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: disputed with him the possession of this submarine property?  What
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

text: This forest was composed of large tree-plants; and the moment we
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: trees, was either broken or bent, nor did they extend horizontally; all
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: when bent to one side by the hand, they directly resumed their former
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: position.  Truly it was the region of perpendicularity!

author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: flora struck me as being very perfect, and richer even than it would
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: have been in the arctic or tropical zones, where these productions are
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: not so plentiful.  But for some minutes I involuntarily confounded the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: genera, taking animals for plants; and who would not have been
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: mistaken?  The fauna and the flora are too closely allied in this
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

text: At last, at five o'clock in the evening, loaded with our riches, we
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: quitted the shore, and half an hour after we hailed the Nautilus.  No
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: one appeared on our arrival.  The enormous iron-plated cylinder seemed
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: deserted.  The provisions embarked, I descended to my chamber, and
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: after supper slept soundly.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: The next day, 6th January, nothing new on board.  Not a sound inside,
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: not a sign of life.  The boat rested along the edge, in the same place
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: in which we had left it.  We resolved to return to the island.  Ned
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: Land hoped to be more fortunate than on the day before with regard to
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: the hunt, and wished to visit another part of the forest.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: At dawn we set off.  The boat, carried on by the waves that flowed to
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: shore, reached the island in a few minutes.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: We landed, and, thinking that it was better to give in to the Canadian,
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: we followed Ned Land, whose long limbs threatened to distance us.  He
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: wound up the coast towards the west:  then, fording some torrents, he
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: gained the high plain that was bordered with admirable forests.  Some
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: kingfishers were rambling along the water-courses, but they would not
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: let themselves be approached.  Their circumspection proved to me that
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: these birds knew what to expect from bipeds of our species, and I
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: concluded that, if the island was not inhabited, at least human beings
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: occasionally frequented it.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: After crossing a rather large prairie, we arrived at the skirts of a
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: little wood that was enlivened by the songs and flight of a large
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: number of birds.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "There are only birds," said Conseil.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "But they are eatable," replied the harpooner.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I do not agree with you, friend Ned, for I see only parrots there."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Friend Conseil," said Ned, gravely, "the parrot is like pheasant to
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: those who have nothing else."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And," I added, "this bird, suitably prepared, is worth knife and fork."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: Indeed, under the thick foliage of this wood, a world of parrots were
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: flying from branch to branch, only needing a careful education to speak
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: the human language.  For the moment, they were chattering with parrots
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: of all colours, and grave cockatoos, who seemed to meditate upon some
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: philosophical problem, whilst brilliant red lories passed like a piece
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: of bunting carried away by the breeze, papuans, with the finest azure
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: colours, and in all a variety of winged things most charming to behold,
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: but few eatable.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: However, a bird peculiar to these lands, and which has never passed the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: limits of the Arrow and Papuan islands, was wanting in this collection.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: But fortune reserved it for me before long.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: After passing through a moderately thick copse, we found a plain
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: obstructed with bushes.  I saw then those magnificent birds, the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: disposition of whose long feathers obliges them to fly against the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: wind.  Their undulating flight, graceful aerial curves, and the shading
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: of their colours, attracted and charmed one's looks.  I had no trouble
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: in recognising them.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Birds of paradise!"  I exclaimed.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: The Malays, who carry on a great trade in these birds with the Chinese,
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: have several means that we could not employ for taking them.  Sometimes
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: they put snares on the top of high trees that the birds of paradise
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: prefer to frequent.  Sometimes they catch them with a viscous birdlime
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: that paralyses their movements.  They even go so far as to poison the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: fountains that the birds generally drink from.  But we were obliged to
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: fire at them during flight, which gave us few chances to bring them
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: down; and, indeed, we vainly exhausted one half our ammunition.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: About eleven o'clock in the morning, the first range of mountains that
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: form the centre of the island was traversed, and we had killed nothing.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: Hunger drove us on.  The hunters had relied on the products of the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: chase, and they were wrong.  Happily Conseil, to his great surprise,
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: made a double shot and secured breakfast.  He brought down a white
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: pigeon and a wood-pigeon, which, cleverly plucked and suspended from a
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: skewer, was roasted before a red fire of dead wood.  While these
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: interesting birds were cooking, Ned prepared the fruit of the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: bread-tree. Then the wood-pigeons were devoured to the bones, and
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: declared excellent.  The nutmeg, with which they are in the habit of
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: stuffing their crops, flavours their flesh and renders it delicious
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: eating.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Now, Ned, what do you miss now?"
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Some four-footed game, M. Aronnax.  All these pigeons are only
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: side-dishes and trifles; and until I have killed an animal with cutlets
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: I shall not be content."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Nor I, Ned, if I do not catch a bird of paradise."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Let us continue hunting," replied Conseil.  "Let us go towards the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: sea.  We have arrived at the first declivities of the mountains, and I
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: think we had better regain the region of forests."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: That was sensible advice, and was followed out.  After walking for one
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: hour we had attained a forest of sago-trees. Some inoffensive serpents
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: glided away from us.  The birds of paradise fled at our approach, and
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: truly I despaired of getting near one when Conseil, who was walking in
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: front, suddenly bent down, uttered a triumphal cry, and came back to me
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: bringing a magnificent specimen.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Ah! bravo, Conseil!"
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Master is very good."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "No, my boy; you have made an excellent stroke.  Take one of these
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: living birds, and carry it in your hand."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "If master will examine it, he will see that I have not deserved great
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: merit."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Why, Conseil?"
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Because this bird is as drunk as a quail."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Drunk!"
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Yes, sir; drunk with the nutmegs that it devoured under the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: nutmeg-tree, under which I found it.  See, friend Ned, see the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: monstrous effects of intemperance!"
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "By Jove!" exclaimed the Canadian, "because I have drunk gin for two
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: months, you must needs reproach me!"
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: However, I examined the curious bird.  Conseil was right.  The bird,
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: drunk with the juice, was quite powerless.  It could not fly; it could
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: hardly walk.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: This bird belonged to the most beautiful of the eight species that are
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: found in Papua and in the neighbouring islands.  It was the "large
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: emerald bird, the most rare kind." It measured three feet in length.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: Its head was comparatively small, its eyes placed near the opening of
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: the beak, and also small.  But the shades of colour were beautiful,
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: having a yellow beak, brown feet and claws, nut-coloured wings with
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: purple tips, pale yellow at the back of the neck and head, and emerald
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: colour at the throat, chestnut on the breast and belly.  Two horned,
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: downy nets rose from below the tail, that prolonged the long light
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: feathers of admirable fineness, and they completed the whole of this
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: marvellous bird, that the natives have poetically named the "bird of
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: the sun."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: But if my wishes were satisfied by the possession of the bird of
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: paradise, the Canadian's were not yet.  Happily, about two o'clock, Ned
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: Land brought down a magnificent hog; from the brood of those the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: natives call "bari-outang." The animal came in time for us to procure
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: real quadruped meat, and he was well received.  Ned Land was very proud
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: of his shot.  The hog, hit by the electric ball, fell stone dead.  The
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: Canadian skinned and cleaned it properly, after having taken half a
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: dozen cutlets, destined to furnish us with a grilled repast in the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: evening.  Then the hunt was resumed, which was still more marked by Ned
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: and Conseil's exploits.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: Indeed, the two friends, beating the bushes, roused a herd of kangaroos
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: that fled and bounded along on their elastic paws.  But these animals
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: did not take to flight so rapidly but what the electric capsule could
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: stop their course.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Ah, Professor!" cried Ned Land, who was carried away by the delights
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: of the chase, "what excellent game, and stewed, too!  What a supply for
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: the Nautilus!  Two! three! five down!  And to think that we shall eat
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: that flesh, and that the idiots on board shall not have a crumb!"
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: I think that, in the excess of his joy, the Canadian, if he had not
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: talked so much, would have killed them all.  But he contented himself
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: with a single dozen of these interesting marsupians.  These animals
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: were small.  They were a species of those "kangaroo rabbits" that live
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: habitually in the hollows of trees, and whose speed is extreme; but
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: they are moderately fat, and furnish, at least, estimable food.  We
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: were very satisfied with the results of the hunt.  Happy Ned proposed
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: to return to this enchanting island the next day, for he wished to
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: depopulate it of all the eatable quadrupeds.  But he had reckoned
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: without his host.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: At six o'clock in the evening we had regained the shore; our boat was
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: moored to the usual place.  The Nautilus, like a long rock, emerged
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: from the waves two miles from the beach.  Ned Land, without waiting,
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: occupied himself about the important dinner business.  He understood
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: all about cooking well.  The "bari-outang," grilled on the coals, soon
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: scented the air with a delicious odour.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: Indeed, the dinner was excellent.  Two wood-pigeons completed this
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: extraordinary menu.  The sago pasty, the artocarpus bread, some
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: mangoes, half a dozen pineapples, and the liquor fermented from some
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: coco-nuts, overjoyed us.  I even think that my worthy companions' ideas
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: had not all the plainness desirable.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Suppose we do not return to the Nautilus this evening?" said Conseil.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Suppose we never return?" added Ned Land.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: Just then a stone fell at our feet and cut short the harpooner's
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: proposition.

author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: We looked at the edge of the forest without rising, my hand stopping in
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: the action of putting it to my mouth, Ned Land's completing its office.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Stones do not fall from the sky," remarked Conseil, "or they would
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: merit the name aerolites."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: A second stone, carefully aimed, that made a savoury pigeon's leg fall
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: from Conseil's hand, gave still more weight to his observation.  We all
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: three arose, shouldered our guns, and were ready to reply to any attack.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Are they apes?" cried Ned Land.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Very nearly--they are savages."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "To the boat!"  I said, hurrying to the sea.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: It was indeed necessary to beat a retreat, for about twenty natives
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: armed with bows and slings appeared on the skirts of a copse that
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: masked the horizon to the right, hardly a hundred steps from us.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: Our boat was moored about sixty feet from us.  The savages approached
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: us, not running, but making hostile demonstrations.  Stones and arrows
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: fell thickly.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ned Land had not wished to leave his provisions; and, in spite of his
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: imminent danger, his pig on one side and kangaroos on the other, he
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: went tolerably fast.  In two minutes we were on the shore.  To load the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: boat with provisions and arms, to push it out to sea, and ship the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: oars, was the work of an instant.  We had not gone two cable-lengths,
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: when a hundred savages, howling and gesticulating, entered the water up
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: to their waists.  I watched to see if their apparition would attract
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

text: Ras-Mohammed. This cape forms the extremity of Arabia Petraea,

text: comprised between the Gulf of Suez and the Gulf of Acabah.

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: two gulfs of Ras-Mohammed. It was Mount Horeb, that Sinai at the top of
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

text: which Moses saw God face to face.

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: water.  According to my calculation we must have been very near Suez.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: night air.

author: Verne, Jules

text: before we gain the entrance of the tunnel."

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: cage and myself direct our course.  And now, if you will go down, M.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

text: Captain Nemo led me towards the central staircase; half way down he
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: It was a cabin measuring six feet square, very much like that occupied
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: by the pilot on the steamboats of the Mississippi or Hudson.  In the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: which ran to the back of the Nautilus.  Four light-ports with
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

text: to the other extremity of the platform.

author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

text: this moment, the immovable base of a massive sandy coast.  We followed
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: modified the course of the Nautilus every instant.

author: Verne, Jules

text: I had placed myself at the port-scuttle, and saw some magnificent
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

text: At a quarter-past ten, the Captain himself took the helm.  A large
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: into it.  A strange roaring was heard round its sides.  It was the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: the brilliant electric light.  My heart beat fast.

author: Verne, Jules

text: The next day, the 12th of February, at the dawn of day, the Nautilus
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: rose to the surface.  I hastened on to the platform.  Three miles to
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: the south the dim outline of Pelusium was to be seen.  A torrent had
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: carried us from one sea to another.  About seven o'clock Ned and
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: Conseil joined me.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Well, Sir Naturalist," said the Canadian, in a slightly jovial tone,
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

text: "and the Mediterranean?"
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "We are floating on its surface, friend Ned."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "What!" said Conseil, "this very night."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: isthmus."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "I do not believe it," replied the Canadian.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Then you are wrong, Master Land," I continued; "this low coast which
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: rounds off to the south is the Egyptian coast.  And you who have such
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: sea."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: The Canadian looked attentively.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Certainly you are right, sir, and your Captain is a first-rate man.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: We are in the Mediterranean.  Good!  Now, if you please, let us talk of
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: our own little affair, but so that no one hears us."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: I saw what the Canadian wanted, and, in any case, I thought it better
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: to let him talk, as he wished it; so we all three went and sat down
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: near the lantern, where we were less exposed to the spray of the blades.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Now, Ned, we listen; what have you to tell us?"
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "What I have to tell you is very simple.  We are in Europe; and before
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: Captain Nemo's caprices drag us once more to the bottom of the Polar
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: Seas, or lead us into Oceania, I ask to leave the Nautilus."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: I wished in no way to shackle the liberty of my companions, but I
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: certainly felt no desire to leave Captain Nemo.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: Thanks to him, and thanks to his apparatus, I was each day nearer the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: completion of my submarine studies; and I was rewriting my book of
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: submarine depths in its very element.  Should I ever again have such an
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: opportunity of observing the wonders of the ocean?  No, certainly not!
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: And I could not bring myself to the idea of abandoning the Nautilus
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: before the cycle of investigation was accomplished.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Friend Ned, answer me frankly, are you tired of being on board?  Are
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: you sorry that destiny has thrown us into Captain Nemo's hands?"
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: The Canadian remained some moments without answering.  Then, crossing
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: his arms, he said:
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Frankly, I do not regret this journey under the seas.  I shall be glad
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: to have made it; but, now that it is made, let us have done with it.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: That is my idea."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "It will come to an end, Ned."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Where and when?"
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Where I do not know--when I cannot say; or, rather, I suppose it will
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: end when these seas have nothing more to teach us."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Then what do you hope for?" demanded the Canadian.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "That circumstances may occur as well six months hence as now by which
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: we may and ought to profit."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Oh!" said Ned Land, "and where shall we be in six months, if you
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: please, Sir Naturalist?"
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Perhaps in China; you know the Nautilus is a rapid traveller.  It goes

author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: beat the coasts of France, England, or America, on which flight may be
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: attempted as advantageously as here."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "M. Aronnax," replied the Canadian, "your arguments are rotten at the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: foundation.  You speak in the future, `We shall be there!  we shall be
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: here!'  I speak in the present, `We are here, and we must profit by
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: it.'"
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: Ned Land's logic pressed me hard, and I felt myself beaten on that
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: ground.  I knew not what argument would now tell in my favour.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "And if," he added, "the offer made you this day was never to be
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: renewed, would you accept it?"
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Friend Ned, this is my answer.  Your reasoning is against me.  We must

author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

text: first opportunity to leave the Nautilus."
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "Only one observation--just one.  The occasion must be serious, and our
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: THE SARGASSO SEA
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: That day the Nautilus crossed a singular part of the Atlantic Ocean.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: No one can be ignorant of the existence of a current of warm water
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: known by the name of the Gulf Stream.  After leaving the Gulf of
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: Florida, we went in the direction of Spitzbergen.  But before entering
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: the Gulf of Mexico, about 45 deg. of N. lat., this current divides into
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: two arms, the principal one going towards the coast of Ireland and
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: Norway, whilst the second bends to the south about the height of the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: Azores; then, touching the African shore, and describing a lengthened
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: oval, returns to the Antilles.  This second arm--it is rather a collar
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: than an arm--surrounds with its circles of warm water that portion of
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: the cold, quiet, immovable ocean called the Sargasso Sea, a perfect
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: lake in the open Atlantic: it takes no less than three years for the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: great current to pass round it.  Such was the region the Nautilus was
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: now visiting, a perfect meadow, a close carpet of seaweed, fucus, and
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: tropical berries, so thick and so compact that the stem of a vessel
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: could hardly tear its way through it.  And Captain Nemo, not wishing to
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: entangle his screw in this herbaceous mass, kept some yards beneath the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: surface of the waves.  The name Sargasso comes from the Spanish word
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: "sargazzo" which signifies kelp.  This kelp, or berry-plant, is the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: principal formation of this immense bank.  And this is the reason why
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: these plants unite in the peaceful basin of the Atlantic.  The only
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: explanation which can be given, he says, seems to me to result from the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: experience known to all the world.  Place in a vase some fragments of
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: cork or other floating body, and give to the water in the vase a
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: circular movement, the scattered fragments will unite in a group in the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: centre of the liquid surface, that is to say, in the part least
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: agitated.  In the phenomenon we are considering, the Atlantic is the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: vase, the Gulf Stream the circular current, and the Sargasso Sea the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: central point at which the floating bodies unite.
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: I share Maury's opinion, and I was able to study the phenomenon in the
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

text: very midst, where vessels rarely penetrate.  Above us floated products

text: Mouth and teeth!  No one could better describe the macrocephalous
title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
author: Verne, Jules

title: Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules

author: Verne, Jules
